tool_description:
RSS cloud proxy service for web publishers, developers and readers.
More @ www.feedr.io
name: Feedr
title: Feedr

api_list.name: Add
api_list.description: The method subscribes you to the seed. If the seed does not exist, it creates a new seed based on the provided link and retrieves feed entries. Note: all non-URL-safe characters must be escaped.

required_parameters.name: link
required_parameters.description: The URL of the source. It matches the "link" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: The name of the seed. It matches the "title" element of the RSS channel.  You can leave it blank, and it will be automatically retrieved from the corresponding feed. Otherwise, it will be overwritten.

optional_parameters.name: description
optional_parameters.description: The detailed description of the seed. It matches the "description" element of the RSS channel.  You can leave it blank, and it will be automatically retrieved from the corresponding feed. Otherwise, it will be overwritten.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The language that the seed is written in. It matches the "language" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: copyright
optional_parameters.description: Copyright notice for content of the seed. It matches the "copyright" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: managing_editor
optional_parameters.description: Contact information of the publisher or other content responsible party. It matches the "managing_editor" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: web_master
optional_parameters.description: Contact information for the technical support. It matches the "web_master" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: pub_date
optional_parameters.description: The date when the content of the seed was officially published. It matches the "pub_date" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: last_build_date
optional_parameters.description: The date when the content of the seed was changed. It matches the "last_build_date" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: docs
optional_parameters.description: The URL that points to the documentation about RSS. According to RSS board, it will never change, so we default it to http://www.rssboard.org/rss-specification. You are more than welcome to specify your own URL to the documentation about your seed. It matches the "docs" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: Time-to-live. Time that defines how often the seed should be updated. It matches the "ttl" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: rating
optional_parameters.description: The PICS rating for the seed. It matches the "rating" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: skip_hours
optional_parameters.description: Specific hours of the day when the seed should not be read. Can contain up to 24 hours, each is between 0 and 23. It matches "skip_hours" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: skip_days
optional_parameters.description: Specific days of the week when the seed should not be read. Can contain up to sever days. It matches "skip_days" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: image_url
optional_parameters.description: The URL to the image associated with the seed.

api_list.name: My IP
api_list.description: The method returns your IP. If the call is made via proxy, proxy IP and your IP are returned.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/ip"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/ip"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Publisher Seeds Add
api_list.description: The method creates a new seed based on the provided link and retrieves feed entries. If the seed is already published by another publisher, the error with the according message is returned. Note: all non-URL-safe characters must be escaped.

api_list.name: Subscriber Feed Entries Search
api_list.description: The method searches every field of every feed entry in the seed of the provided link.

required_parameters.name: link
required_parameters.description: Feed url with all non-alphanumeric characters escaped.

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: The name of the field to order by.

optional_parameters.name: dir
optional_parameters.description: The direction of the order for the field specified in {order}. If the parameter is not specified or provided anything else than "asc" or "desc", then it defaults to "asc".

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The amount of feed entries to return. If the parameter is specified, then {p} and {ps} are ignored.

optional_parameters.name: smr
optional_parameters.description: The flag that specifies whether feed entries summaries must be returned.

api_list.name: Kill
api_list.description: The method deletes the seed of the provided id along with all related feed entries. Returns the status and the deleted seed.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The unique identification number in Feedr.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/kill/1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/kill/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: All
api_list.description: The method returns all the seeds you are subscribed to (a.k.a. your subscriptions).

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.

api_list.name: Publisher Seeds All
api_list.description: The method returns all the seeds you publish (a.k.a. your publications).

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.

api_list.name: Digest
api_list.description: The method returns the set of feed entries for the seed of the provided link.

optional_parameters.name: link
optional_parameters.description: Feed url with all non-alphanumeric characters escaped. It is required if {id} is not provided.

optional_parameters.name: order
optional_parameters.description: The name of the field to order by.

optional_parameters.name: dir
optional_parameters.description: The direction of the order for the field specified in {order}. If the parameter is not specified or provided anything else than "asc" or "desc", then it defaults to "asc".

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The amount of feed entries to return. If the parameter is specified, then {p} and {ps} are ignored.

optional_parameters.name: smr
optional_parameters.description: The flag that specifies whether feed entries summaries must be returned.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: The unique identification number of a seed in Feedr. It is required if {link} is not provided.

api_list.name: Subscriber Seeds Unsubscribe
api_list.description: The method unsubscribes you from the seed.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/unsubscribe/1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/unsubscribe/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Read
api_list.description: The method retrieves all seeds that either you own, or you are subscribed to. Returns the status and the seed set.

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.

api_list.name: Subscriber Feed Entry
api_list.description: The method retrieves a specific feed entry and all related custom fields by provided id. If the feed entry of the provided id does not exist or you do not have access to the seed of the feed entry, then no feed entry will be returned.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The unique identification number in Feedr.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/entries/1"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://feedr.p.rapidapi.com/entries/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Change
api_list.description: The method updates the provided properties of the seed of the provided id. All non-URL-safe characters must be escaped. Returns the status and the updated seed.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The unique identification number in Feedr.

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: The name of the seed. It matches the "title" element of the RSS channel. You can leave it blank, and it will be automatically retrieved from the corresponding feed. Otherwise, it will be overwritten.

optional_parameters.name: description
optional_parameters.description: The detailed description of the seed. It matches the "description" element of the RSS channel. You can leave it blank, and it will be automatically retrieved from the corresponding feed. Otherwise, it will be overwritten.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The language that the seed is written in. It matches the "language" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: copyright
optional_parameters.description: Copyright notice for content of the seed. It matches the "copyright" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: managing_editor
optional_parameters.description: Contact information of the publisher or other content responsible party. It matches the "managing_editor" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: web_master
optional_parameters.description: Contact information for the technical support. It matches the "web_master" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: pub_date
optional_parameters.description: The date when the content of the seed was officially published. It matches the "pub_date" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: last_build_date
optional_parameters.description: The date when the content of the seed was changed. It matches the "last_build_date" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: docs
optional_parameters.description: The URL that points to the documentation about RSS. According to RSS board, it will never change, so we default it to http://www.rssboard.org/rss-specification. You are more than welcome to specify your own URL to the documentation about your seed. It matches the "docs" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: Time-to-live. Time that defines how often the seed should be updated. It matches the "ttl" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: rating
optional_parameters.description: The PICS rating for the seed. It matches the "rating" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: skip_hours
optional_parameters.description: Specific hours of the day when the seed should not be read. Can contain up to 24 hours, each is between 0 and 23. It matches "skip_hours" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: skip_days
optional_parameters.description: Specific days of the week when the seed should not be read. Can contain up to sever days. It matches "skip_days" element of the RSS channel.

optional_parameters.name: cron_job_frequence
optional_parameters.description: Update frequency. The value specifies how many hours between each update there are, starting now. The values must be between 0 and 24. To turn the cron job off, you need to send 0 as the parameter.

api_list.name: Subscriber Seed Fix
api_list.description: The method sets title and/or description for a seed for a subscriber's personal use.

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "feedr.p.rapidapi.com"

print(response.json())

optional_parameters.name: p
optional_parameters.description: The page number. If the parameter is greater than the total number of pages, the method returns an empty array. If the parameter is not provided, the method returns all seeds and {ps} is ignored.

optional_parameters.name: ps
optional_parameters.description: The page size. The amount of seeds returned is equal to or less than the parameter. The parameter is ignored, if {p} is not provided. If the parameter is not provided, then it defaults to 20.
